newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh police use teargas to avert battle.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh police use teargas to avert battle.

text.p: Police used batons and tear-gas to avoid a clash on Friday between thousands of orthodox Islamic activists and political groups opposing them, witnesses said.
Both groups almost came face to face after Friday noon prayers at Dhaka's Baitul Mokarram mosque, which had been surrounded by riot police since morning.
Police used metal detectors to check those entering the mosque but found no weapons, witnesses said.
Tension built as anti-fundamentalist groups approached the mosque and police moved in with batons and fired tear-gas after the rival groups tried to attack each other.
Thousands of mullahs later squatted on the street outside the mosque and chanted against what they called "police barbarism".

The mullahs have been flexing their muscles since July 15 when they spearheaded a general strike across the country over attempts to "defame and ridicule" the Prophet Mohammad by a Jewish woman in Hebron.
The woman plastered storefronts with posters depicting the Prophet as a pig, triggering Moslem outrage around the world.
